boardgame.name: Rovers van de Noordzee: Helden uit het Noorden
boardgame.description:
This is a big box expansion for the Dutch market that contains two expansions (Hall of Heroes and Fields of Fame), the solo variant and some bonus cards.

In Raiders of the North Sea: Hall of Heroes, a mead hall has been constructed, attracting a new breed of adventurers. Each raid brings new quests for the daring to endure. But with mead in abundance, there is little room for the wary, so sharpen your axe and ready your shield as new adventures await!

In addition to including components for an extra player, Hall of Heroes has the new mead hall board, large player boards, mead, quests, reputation, and a variety of new townsfolk.

In Raiders of the North Sea: Fields of Fame, enemy jarls have joined forces to help defend against the onslaught of raids on their settlements. But despite their threats, there is fame awaiting those who seek to kill or subdue them. Encountering a jarl is sure to bring injury, but now is no time for the faint-hearted. Onwards to the battlefield!

In addition to including components for an extra player, Fields of Fame also includes the new township board, enemy jarl tokens and cards, fame, damage and a variety of new townsfolk.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 4)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is issue No. 4 of Dungeon Vault Magazine. A compilation of adventures, lore, excellent cartography, and useful digital goodies.

Dungeon Vault Magazine is all about providing interesting ideas and lore to DMs and storytellers. Within this issue, you will find varied adventure ideas.

These short modules do not stick to a unified template of sections. Instead, they are organically created and follow their own pace. The types of modules you can expect are city/town settings, regional settings, dungeons, outdoor locations, encounter maps, and one-page adventures.

The modules are written with the 5th ed. OGL in mind but rules are often left to a minimum. Most adventures are appropriate for low to mid-level (Levels 1 to 10) adventur­ing parties. We include a note at the beginning of each adventure with a ballpark estimation of party level and playing time.

boardgame.name: The Neophyte's Guide to the Invisible
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The scope of human knowledge and endeavor is woefully limited, compared to the incalculable vastness of the cosmos as it truly is.

Bloodlines & Black Magic is an occult and horror-themed tabletop role-playing game set in the modern world. Designed around the d20, Bloodlines & Black Magic brings gamers a different kind of strange, supernatural world.

This short guide is intended to be a brief introduction to Bloodlines & Black Magic, the world in which it is set, and the storytelling themes GMs might deploy within the setting. This short, free guide is designed to introduce you to the world of Bloodlines & Black Magic. Presented in a series of seven short lessons and matching sidebars, this guide describes the worlds in which the characters play, how characters discover those worlds, and how the denizens of those worlds react to their discovery. Designed to complement the Bloodlines & Black Magic play-through Houses of Halifax, this guide introduces potential players and GMs to common terms, concepts, and themes.

Calling all hopeless romantics! Percival's Propitious Pairings is now hiring! Ah, but what is this business, you ask? Dear friend, it is merely matchmaking...with a twist. Let us consult some of our most vocal supporters, and former clients.

"Percival's Propitious Pairings helped me overcome my propensity to shapeshift mid-date, and now I've been going steady with Caroline for two years!" -Egmund, werewolf

This level 3 adventure tasks the players with arranging the perfect date for an unlikely couple while battling such obstacles as belligerent beach bums, roving werewolf packs, and snooty aristocrats. It's a delightful, light-hearted romp that should take your group 2-3 hours to complete. Percival's Propitious Pairings includes original character art by the author, two monster stat blocks, and a magic item.

If the witches fail, chaos reigns forever.

Long ago, order was forged from chaos. And chaos didn’t like it. Ever since, the Darkshayde, the personification of disorder, has been trying to return the world to what it believes is its natural state. For a time, it was successful, but then the earth developed an immune system: magic, and chief among the practitioners of that art are the witches.

Hexpunk offers Cepheus Engine (a direct descendant of the Original Science-Fiction Roleplaying Game) players an urban fantasy mini-campaign based on shows such as Charmed, The Chilling Adventures of Sabrina, American Horror Story: Coven, even Teen Witch and Bewitched, against the backdrop of the age-old battle between order and chaos that has stretched into the modern day. Grab your spellbooks and gather the coven. The Darkshayde is coming…

boardgame.name: The Fallout Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Fallout Universe, inspired the series of Fallout video games, is an exploration of America after a nuclear apocalypse brings the world to its knees. Despite the complete and total decimation of society, humans continue to fight for survival in this new and hazardous world.

To understand what the world became, you must first realize what the world came from. The Fallout universe takes place in an alternate timeline for the one we are familiar with in the real world. This timeline starts to branch off near the close of World War II. Communism thrives and fails to collapse heading into the 21st century, and its threat on free market economy grows deeper than ever. The world’s resources continued to dwindle, causing polarizing political conflicts that fracture alliances and strains international relations.

Despite it all, technology continues to advance aggressively. Incredible advancements are made in technology and robotics, while maintaining a real world 1950s aesthetic. Soldiers become equipped with laser rifles, plasma grenades, and suits of highly advanced powered combat armor. Robots become so mainstream that they are used for all purposes, from frontline combat to janitorial duties and child rearing. Technology becomes powered by miniaturized fusion technology rather than the world’s rapidly depleting oil reservoirs.

This shortage of oil provokes the communist Chinese government to invade Alaska for its resources in the year 2066. Alaska becomes a war zone between China and the United States, as the two powerhouse nations begin a back and forth struggle of decimating each other’s nation.

At this point, the signs are pointing to the end of mankind. Many begin to take steps for the annihilation of the world. Most notably, a massive series of underground vaults are established across the United States. These bunkers are intended to take a population of individuals and keep them and their descendants safe underground throughout a nuclear apocalypse. Designed to last for many generations, these vaults are designed for the long term survival of mankind.

In the morning hours of October 23, 2077, the Great War reaches its climax. The United States, China, and many other nations release their nuclear payload on each other. Within hours, the entire world becomes a devastated, irradiated wasteland. Contemporary society as it was ceases to exist. It was to be the end of mankind.

boardgame.name: Jump River
boardgame.description:
Jump River

Summary

Jump River is a game of wits for two players. The goal is to have your fish reach the other river without being captured by the cats! But cats beware, dogs are on the prowl to protect their fishy friends. Move the most fish to the opposite riverbank to win!


of Players


2 Players All Ages
(2-4 players with expansion)

Fish Pieces - These represent your fish and can move in any direction, One space at a time

14 pink 14 Green

Cat Pieces - These represent your cats! Use your cats to target the opposition’s fish.

2 Pink 2 Green

Dog Piece - Each player has a dog piece! The dog can be used to block or attack cats.

1Pink 1 Green

River Race Cards(aka Fish Bowl Cards) - These cards can help you to attack/block an opponent player - among other things!

28 cards

Gameboard

10x10

Set-Up

To begin each player collects 14 Fish pieces, two Cat pieces, and one Dog piece.

Each player should put their 10 Fish in the first-row space closest to their river, and rest their 4 Fishes in the river water by their bank.

Dog in the river water by their bank

Cats in the river water by their bank

Shuffle all the River Race Cards(aka Fish Bowl Cards) and distribute each player 14 cards or equally -

Once both players have placed their fish, pieces the game is ready to begin.

Rules and Gameplay.

Players can move any there fish from the first row to second row then second replace cats first and dogs there wish.

Players take turns moving any of their pieces on the board. Each piece moves differently:

Dogs can move horizontally or vertically in any distance across the board. They can only attack Cats or other Dogs.

Cats can only move diagonally across the board in any distance. They can only attack Fish, not Dogs.

Fish can move one space at a time in any direction only 1 cell at a time.

In addition:

When a Fish is on top of water space, can not attack them for any reason.

When a Cat attacks a Fish, the player draws a River Racecard and face up and plays it when it is required in the game. ( opponent players can plan strategies accordingly)


Players can move any fish Jump into an opponent's river that player can draw a River Racecard and face up and play it when it is required in the game. ( opponent players can plan strategies accordingly)


When a Cat attacks a Fish, it is removed from the game (discarded outside of the board).

When a Dog attacks a Cat, Cat is removed from the game as well.

Based on the rules of play, the game ends when there are no Fish left on the board. The winner is whichever player has moved the most Fish to the opposite river.

River RaceDeck :

River Racecards are obtained when a player moves their fish to an opponent's water space. They may then draw a card and use it immediately. Once a card is used, it must be discarded from play.

Also When a Cat attacks a Fish, the player draws a River Racecard and face up and plays it when it is required in the game. ( opponent players can plan strategies accordingly)

Note: Once a card is used, it must be discarded from play.

â Go fish (2 Cards )-–Return the user to an opponent’s fish from their first row.
â Doggie Treat (2 Cards)-- Your opponent can’t use their Dog for one turn.
â Block Shield (2 Cards)-player can block any attack one turn.
â Bird (2 cards) -Hunt an opponent’s fish from their river and discard it from the game.
â Fish hook 2cards -You can discard opponent 1 fish from the game.
â Catnip 2 cards-Your opponent can’t use their Cat for one turn.
â Fish Flop 2 Cards -Move any one Fish horizontally two spaces.
â Fishbowl Cards(2 cards) - Move the number of Fish shown on the card directly into the other player’s river. There are 2 types of Fishbowl cards:, 0 Fish, 1 Fish.
Angelfish 1 card - reborn dead fish one time from the discarded game.
Swordfish 2 cards - Fish can attack opponent fish one time and discard it from the game.
Fish Flop 2 Cards -Move any one Fish diagonally two spaces.
Fish flop 2 Cards -Move any one Fish (L) Shape 4steps..
Fish flop 2 Cards -jump one time on any opponent 1 piece.
Skip card 2 Cards- players can skip opponent turn-on time.
Queenfish 1 card - Fish can receive Cat or Dog power one time (it's upon players choice).

boardgame.name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 â Nieuport 16
boardgame.description:
The Nieuport 16 was an evolution of the Nieuport 11, reinforced and modified to fit a new, more powerful engine, and used as a fighter, bomber escort, and in balloon busting. It was armed with a single Lewis machine–gun, set in a difficult to reach position over the upper wing and when used in balloon busting with four Le Prieur rockets on each side. With a top speed of over 100 mph (ca. 161 km/h), it was superior to its predecessors, but lacked in maneuverability; still, it represented an important stepping stone for the Nieuport line.

Nieuport 16 (Ball)
Considered a “lone wolf,” Albert Ball was a British ace scoring multiple victories on this Nieuport, including the destruction of an observation balloon with phosphor bombs.

Each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of cards.

— Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 â RAF SE.5
boardgame.description:
The RAF SE.5 fighter (quickly becoming the SE.5a) was one of the aircraft that turned the air war around for the Allies. Both fast and maneuverable, it was easy to fly and an excellent gun platform, as demonstrated by the many aces who scored most of their victories in the airplane. Though engine problems inhibited its early success, once they were solved, it became one of the best fighters of the entire War, able to match or beat anything the Germans flew. Over 5000 aircraft were produced.

Raf SE.5 (Bishop)
The Canadian ace “Billy” Bishop was one of the top scoring pilots of the World War I (72 victories), including 25 in one 10-day period. He was awarded the Victoria Cross and several other decorations.

Raf SE.5a (Dallas)
Roderic Dallas was one of the top–scoring pilots from Australia shooting down 32 enemies, nine victories flying on SE.5a, before being shot down by members of Jasta 14 on 1 June 1918 above Liévin, in France.

Raf SE.5a (McCudden)
James McCudden began the war as an observer and became the most highly decorated Allied airman, a precise and patient pilot that achieved 57 victories, most of which came flying in the glorious SE.5a.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stranger Settings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange Yet Familiar Surroundings

Welcome to Crestview Hills, Circa 1984...

There are numerous creative, innovative ways to take the same base rules and tweak just a few details and play radically different games without needing to learn a totally new system. Simple things like changing the era of your game of Stranger Stuff from the 1980’s to any other time period, or switching up the location from middle America to New England or the South for instance, are all things we feel you can easily and comfortably do without even a micro-setting. Instead, we’re attempting to with this book to first present our existing world of Crestview Hills along side four all-new micro-settings that have potential ways to play your game that make some more significant changes to the game (while still being completely compliant with the rules as presented).

What we have here in Stranger Settings are alternate ideas of games to play, that are designed to be used with TinyD6, specifically the Stranger Stuff for TinyD6 game. Written as alternatives to the default setting of your own creation — but assumed to be "small town America." You could potentially use any of these settings with nearly any of the TinyD6 games, but all of the settings are assuming you own and want to run Stranger Stuff for TinyD6 as we designed that game. The only setting that inherently assumes you own more than the core Stranger Stuff book is St. Cyprian's School of Witchcraft, which we feel plays best when you own our book on witchcraft for TinyD6, [Stranger Stuff: Teenage Witchcraft].

Micro-Settings Include:


This Old, Dark House

In this setting, the Players take on the role of a Family (Mom, Dad, and children) that move into a classic “old and creepy house” they’ve recently come into from an inheritance. Obviously, not everything is as it seems, and life in the house is a bit Stranger than expected.


A Town Called Epiphany

In this setting, the Players take on the role of Super Genius Kids, in an entire town dedicated to being the “World’s Best & Brightest,” but when Mom & Dad work long hours in laboratories pushing science beyond the bleeding edge, the annual Science Fair can take on a Stranger tone as participants are doing more than baking soda volcanoes.


Troubled Teens

In this setting, the Players take on the role of Troubled Teens, kids that are on their last stop before being sent to prison — but this Special Care facility is Stranger than most, and it’s not just the creepy way the staff are acting but the bizarre powers the Kids begin to exhibit as well.


St. Cyprian’s School of Witchcraft

In this setting, the Players take on the role of Witches from our Stranger Stuff: Teenage Witchcraft book. While the setting can be played using the Spell-Touched and Spell Reader Power Traits as presented in the core Stranger Stuff book, to get the most out of the Stranger education you’ll receive at St. Cyprian’s we highly recommend you have a copy of Teenage Witchcraft.

All you need to get started is a standard Stranger Stuff character (and that core ruleboook of course) and these rules and you can seamlessly integrate your characters becoming budding witches in no time!

boardgame.name: Wow! vs the Intergalactic Space Whale
boardgame.description:
A hungry intergalactic space whale has wandered upon planet WOW! It has vacuumed up all the animals from the Zoo for Endangered Alien Animals. In this co-op game, our young players will assemble a team of superdupers to venture into the whale's bowels and rescue the animals by matching various, age-appropriate patterns between alien cards.

Kids love co-op games, but when playing with a different ages, complex games may bore the young players and basic games bore the older players. This co-op game provides three levels of difficulty: picture-pattern-matching for pre-K, letter-matching for K-2, and rhyming-word matching for 3rd-grade and up. Players will choose their own level of difficulty and can switch to easier patterns at anytime should they get fatigued.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: War with Goblins
boardgame.description:
1. The core gameplay of War with Goblins is the fight between different troops and conquering cities. Each player has at his disposal many units, which he can successively introduce to the game if he has only the right number of ducats. About 24 different types of troops take part in the war. On the obverse of the board we have the land map and on the reverse the second, sea map. The game has climatic, oldschool fantasy graphics, perfectly depicting a magical world in which humans coexist with goblins.

2. This is a turn-based war game. The board is divided into areas. Each of them has one type of terrain assigned to it. Terrain affects the movement of units as well as their combat strength. There are 12 cities on the board, a number of villages and dungeons, which are the source of money (ducats).
Each player in his turn can buy troops on the board (in the form of tokens), moves them, occupy areas and fights battles. The strength of the units, their HP, and partly the dice decide about the result of the clashes. Units can be combined into larger groups, up to 4 units.

3. The player who has the most cities after 6, 8 or 10 rounds wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:
In Drawn to Adventure, you and up to three other adventurers will embark on an epic journey across the Five Realms, where you can use your skills and abilities to slay monsters and complete quests. You will have the chance to earn many rewards, such as mana to activate special powers; experience to level up your character; and—of course—glorious treasure!

—description from the publisher

Frontline: The Miniature Game â Core Rulebook: Rules for Tabletop Battles in WWII â Pacific and South East Asia 1941-1945
boardgame.description:
The Frontline Miniature Core Rulebook covers all rules you need to reenact battles in the Pacific and South East Asia, including dogfights.

It works for these miniature sizes: 1:100, 1:72, 1:56

There are many other miniature games on the market, but mostly the Pacific is only a side notice. The battles in the Pacific and South East Asia played an important role in the war and for a tabletop gamer it has a lot of potential for modelling, collecting and gaming as well. That‘s why we decided to lay the focus on it, because we are very interested in that period of time and it‘s worth to learn more about it.

What you get in the Frontline Miniature Core Rulebook:

Comprehensive basics, optional and advanced rules
Organisation lists for Pacific WWII nations
Tanks and gun charts
Numbered rules set out in a clear order of play for easy reference
Rules explanation backed by photos and diagrams
Standard and special scenarios for re-play, illustrating the rules in action
Rules for air combat
Practical tips and hints for setting up exciting tabletop battles

boardgame.name: Nuke?
boardgame.description:
"The people sitting around your table have been lying to you. They are actually the most powerful leaders of industry the world has ever seen, with massive stockpiles of resources and weapons, probably hiding somewhere in their basement. Can you trust them? Can they trust you? I don't know, but I'm pickin' up some strange vibes. Could be that tuna I ate earlier..."

Nuke? the Card Game puts players in the hot-seat as billionaires and world leaders with two simple goals: 1) to make more many than they ever did, 2) to not get blowed up.

You will be embodying a richer you, and over the course of 3 rounds, collecting sets of commodities to ensure a profitable asset portfolio. How will you accomplish this? Through trade negotiations of course! In real-time, you and your friends will be making deals as shrewdly as possible, but it's in the follow through that your true colours will show. Should you deal honestly and fulfill your end of the bargain? Or should you forsake your responsibility and send the all-dreaded nuke? See, here's the trick: all of the cards that are traded remain hidden until the end of the round. And then, just when you think you're all set to make a fat stack of dough... you flip your cards to reveal 3 nukes! Thanks guys, thanks a lot.

To add a little more chaos into the mix you'll receive a secret identity, and in the second round you'll get 2, and in the third round, 3. Talk about split personalities... These Identity cards might give you a scoring bonus or even a powerful single-use ability to whap out at the most opportune time. Pretty neat! Now it's time for you to put your power of persuasion to the test. But even for the shrewdest shark, at the end of the day the only question that remains is this: should you be a stable and trustworthy friend, or should you send a Nuke?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hierarchy: Emissary
boardgame.description:
Solo expansion for Hierarchy.


Two noble families have been fighting over the throne for years, and the people of the kingdom have suffered. You’ve been sent to make sure there is an uneventful transition into a new age of peace. To be a successful Emissary, you must play all 14 cards.

Hierarchy: Emissary comes with 3 double sided Edict cards that give special abilities, as well as three alternate game cards (Impostor, Tower, and Surgeon) to swap in for solo play.

At any time, you may discard an Edict card to use its printed ability. You must be able to resolve the card in order to use it. For example, if there are no cards left in the deck, you cannot “Return a card to the bottom of the deck.”

It also comes in three levels of difficulty. In the Standard and Expert difficulties, after you fully resolve the Edict, you must remove the bottom card in the line and place it on top of its deck, extending the length of the game.

While it's not required, we also made a sweet playmat for solo play. If you like to go all out, the playmats are always really nice.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Polemos: War of the Spanish Succession â Chosen Men, Well Disposed
boardgame.description:
Polemos War of Spanish Succession is specifically aimed at enabling the wargamer to fight large scale actions; actual battles, rather than small scale skirmishes. Systems for firing, melee and morale are straightforward and easy to learn, but allow your troops to emulate the tactics used by their historical counterparts. For instance, troops using the platoon firing system have improved close range factors, while others using fire by ranks are allowed to be more aggressive.

Chosen men, well disposed is therefore produced as one of two sets of rules produced to cover the period.
CMWD enables the player to recreate the small to medium sized battles of the War of Spanish Succession, or crucial parts of the major battles. Use CMWD you can, if you wish, replay General Webb’s action at Wynendael or perhaps the attack of the Allied left column on the village of Blenheim.

The aim of the rules is to allow you to fight actions of this size to a finish in three to four hours while retaining the feel of warfare in this period and giving you some tactical control over your troops

The same wargames figures may be used in both sets of rules, as the basing system is universal; only the nominal scale will differ.

Basing and Representation

The basic unit of manoeuvre in Polemos CMWS is the Base - a group of wargames figures mounted permanently on a single base of a given size. The actual position of the figures on the base is not important, nor is it important that the base sizes given below are adhered to. So long as both armies use the same basing system, the rules should not be affected.
A base of infantry in CMWD represents between 300 and 500 men. This generally represents a battalion in most armies of the period. Some armies tended to field larger battalions and these will be represented by two bases.
A base of cavalry represents a regiment or two to three squadrons.
An artillery base represents 2-3 guns.
All distances in Polemos games are expressed in Base Widths (BW) and Base Depths (BD) in order to allow the use of differing base sizes. A BD is half a BW.
This system means that any size can be used for bases, so no rebasing is required so long as both sides are consistent. We believe that a 60mm x 30mm base gives the best results in terms of both practical use and visual impact.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dragons of Aihrde: Lesser Wyrms
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within Dragons of Aihrde: Lesser Wyrms, you'll find a veritable host of dragons.But it is not the greater wyrms you've known, those chromatic dragons are for other tomes.Here you will find their cousins, the lesser wyrms.From the brutally violent Maegle Wyrm that grinds its prey to pulp to the far "gentler" Iris Dragon that paralyzes and feeds upon its victim for days.These dragons are creatures from our uncertain nightmares.

Like all dragons, lesser dragons (wyrms) are powerful creatures with magical abilities and uncommonly long life spans. These dragons are every bit as cunning, but not as intelligent as their more commonly known kin. They are smaller as well, few growing to over 20 feet in length. They are more animal in nature, less discerning in their actions, more concerned about hunting or breeding than hoarding treasure and unraveling the philosophy of men. They can be good or evil, but many are simply neutral; once again, closer to animals than magical beasts.

With these lesser dragons you can design encounters for low level or high level characters. Each entry comes complete with all the stats needed to unleash their fury, as well as descriptions, habits and ecology!

boardgame.name: Hokko Life
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Hokko Life is a creativity-filled community sim game that invites players to escape the hustle-bustle and relax in their new home of Hokko. Build the town of your dreams with Hokko Life's creativity tools, which allow you to customize and design furniture, clothing, and much more! Those creative juices not flowing? Why not relax and while away the hours at a local fishing spot; out hunting bugs; or tending to your garden! Features


CRAFT: Head to the forest or the abandoned mine to chop; mine, and dig for resources. Take what you've collected back to town and craft them into materials you can use in your own designs.



DESIGN: Gather your materials and head into the workshop to put your own spin on every item in the game. Use the design table to build your own furniture, combining different shapes and materials in a simple but powerful editor.



PAINT: Pop on your overall, get out those brushes and throw some colour down. You can design wallpaper, flooring and even T-Shirts for you and the villagers to wear. Get everyone in town wearing your own unique designs!



BUILD & DECORATE: Enlist the help of the resident builder and start expanding the town. Place buildings wherever you like and get them ready for new villagers to move to town. Customize these new homes inside and out; choose designs and place furniture to make a home your new friends will love.



FARM: Turn any plot of land into a place to grow vegetables and other plants, use your green fingers to grow and sell the best produce.



FISH: Spend a quiet morning at the various fishing spots around the world of Hokko and build your fishing collection. Fish have unique habits, so you'll need to vary your approach, with each catch providing it's own challenge when you reel in.



BUG HUNT: Fluttering and scuttling about the world of Hokko you'll find a whole range of insects for you to catch and build your collection with; keep a eye out, you never know what might be hiding in that bush!


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Sayri: The Beginning
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





FIND YOUR WAY TO A NEW HOMEForced to flee their homeworld after catastrophic events, Sayri has crash-landed on the stunning world of Ayris. Inspired by its beauty, they are compelled to explore this unfamiliar planet in search of a new home. The journey has just begun, and Sayri will need to overcome many challenges that may be too great to face alone.

A TALE OF FRIENDSHIP, LOVE AND LOSS

Discover every secret Ayris has to offer by forming new friendships with curious locals along the way. Every creature you meet will have a unique ability to aid Sayri in their quest to find answers and settle into a new home. Open your heart to those in need and they may, in turn, repay the favor.

A BREATHTAKING WORLD, FULL OF MYSTERY

Every corner of Ayris will offer organic puzzles immersed in the planet’s environments. Exploring this world will reveal many obstacles along your path. It’s a good thing you have friends to help you! Will you find all of the hidden secrets? Each one will unlock new fragments of the story and exciting abilities to make for an unforgettable adventure.

A GAME FOR EVERYONE

Sayri: The Beginning is designed to captivate people of all ages. The psychological complexity of the story will inspire your imagination, while the vibrant character designs will appeal to your inner child. If you want the video game equivalent of a warm hug, this might just be it.

Key features:


Experience a story of wonder, friendship, and overcoming loss.
Explore a gorgeous, handcrafted world brimming with adventure.
Befriend intriguing alien creatures and learn to put your faith in their unique talents.
Solve organic puzzles lovingly blended within the game’s environments.
Overcome obstacles using Sayri’s telekinetic powers and the help of your new friends.
Discover many secrets and unlock new abilities.
Uncover the truth behind what happened and find a new home for Sayri.


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.description:
Sin Rummy is a brand new game - a vicious twist on one of the most popular card games of all time (Gin Rummy).

The game itself is elegantly contained inside a gorgeous deck of the highest-quality playing cards, manufactured by the United States Playing Card Company.

Sin Rummy follows the rules of Rummy, with a simple exception: before each round starts, each player is dealt one 'social sin' card face up on the table. This card changes the rules for only the player that has it, for the entirety of that round. Then play proceeds with whatever variant of Rummy you prefer.

boardgame.name: Cold War 3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990
boardgame.description:
COLD WAR3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990 allows you to field a tabletop army (and fight with it) in 6mm, 15mm or even 20mm (or any combination thereof!) from the early Cold war right up to it's finish in 1990.


This comprehensive rulebook includes TWO complete orders of battle for the American and Soviet forces split into three sections:
1960-'70 -Early;
1970-'80 -Middle; and
1980-'90 -Late COLD WAR if you will.




This book covers rules for armoured, mechanised and infantry assaults, movement, firing, night fighting, engineers, scouts, snipers, medics and battlefield recovery.
It also includes rules for modern anti-tank weapons from the AT-3 through to the TOW II and Milan ATGM's as well as modern armour such as ERA (explosive reactive armour), Composite (such as Chobham) and things such as side skirts and improvised armour.



Rules for artillery, including all of the sub-munitions such as FASCAM (scaterable mines), DPICM (boosted rounds), Copperhead (guided rounds) and High Explosive, chemical and smoke rounds as well!



Rules for air support and even surface-to-air-missiles, aircraft firing on ground targets, straffing runs, bombing runs and avoiding ground fire are all included as well as such ordinance as smart bombs, high explosives, rocket pods and even napalm! Loitering, air to air combat and re-arming are also included. Rules for helicopters, gunships and even medical evacuation are covered in depth as well.



A comprehensive air craft armoury lists is included covering everything from the A1 Skyhawk to the A-10, the F14, F15, F16 and even F-18, the F-104 through to the Phantom and even A6 crusaders!For the Russians we have the Mig-15 through to Mig-29, the Su-25, Su-11 and even Su-7 ground attack, the Tu-11 and Tu-95 bombers to bring added carnage to the battlefield!



Optional rules can take your COLD WAR 3! Battles to new, hotter, levels with the inclusion of chemical, biological and even nuclear effects are covered as well as on-table explosions, loitering times, decontamination, detection and even on-table nuclear explosions!



Modern armour from the T34/85 through to the T-80u, the M48a1 right through to the M1a2 and all manner of armoured vehicles in between such as the BTR family of wheeled APC's, the BMP-1 and BMP-2 and the ubiquitous M-113 family of armoured personnel carriers and the modern M2 and M3 Bradleys!


These rules are compatible with other popular 15mm tabletop games such as TY and FoW as well as other titles produced by Dean Wilson.

—description from the publisher

The Secrets of the Ring Dancers, Before Their Fae Enslavement

Tribebook Ceilican is an exploration into the Ceilican Bastet for Werewolf: the Savage Age and Werewolf: the Apocalypse. This all-new 45 page book is filled with the history, legends, and character options needed to play a Ceilican in the prehistoric Savage Age.

The Ceilican have been defined for far too long solely by their Fae enslavement. This book explores who the Ceilican were before their durance in Arcandia, telling their story on their terms. The Ceilican were wanderers, keen to discover secrets they believed Gaia hid across her physical form specifcially for them. They were also some of the first Fera to see the exciting possibilitites in civilization and language.

...then the War of Rage came to them.

In addition to their history before Arcadia, this book also discusses why many of the Ceilican made the hard choice to flee to Arcadia as their prison-refuge from the predations of the War of Rage.

The Ceilican, Finally On Their Own Terms

While this book is primarily written as a supplement for Weaponized Ink's Werewolf: the Savage Age, the background and mechanics are designed to be flexible enough to add defition and deepen the story for Ceilican characters in a modern nights chronicle.

An exploration and redefinition of the Ceilican,

boardgame.name: 100 Silent Strider Kinfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dangerous things lurk in the night, but few of them are as deadly as the garou of the Silent Striders. Tracing their lineage to the ancient empire of Egypt, they are known as the messengers of the nation, but they are so much more than that. Banished from their homeland by an ancient curse, and cut off from their ancestors, the Silent Striders wander the world, searching for ways they can once again return home.

The tribe’s kinfolk share this same wanderlust, along with Owl’s quiet danger. Though many of them mind hostels and hotels, bars and restaurants, others embrace professions that keep them untethered from permanent communities and homes. While they may be seen as taciturn lone wolves by outsiders, when the tribe howls, its kin come from seemingly nowhere to provide much-needed aid. And when the task is done, they vanish back into the wind once more.

Ukraine ! Invasion & Civil War 2014 -present -Russian Forces is the first book in the CRISIS UKRAINE trilogy.
This volume covers the Russian Army volunteers* who are currently fighting in Ukraine. This book focuses primarily on the 9th Motor Rifle brigade, 18th Guards Motor Rifle Brigade and the 200th Motor Rifle Brigade as those are volunteer* units that have been positively identified as being on Ukrainian Soil. This book can be used for the Ukrainian Civil War of 2014, the Annexation (Invasion) of Crimea and the continued fighting in the Donbas-Luhansk region(s) of Ukraine.

Included in this volume are comprehensive rules for the modern electronic battlefield, including ground surveillance radars, drone cameras, armed drones, IR smoke, Krasnopol Ammunition, upgraded ATGM’s such as the Akaka and the Shturm as well as trench fighting, and upgraded armour for Russian tanks such as the Shotra/Arena package and Kontakt-5 ERA and composite armours!

This book introduces new Russian equipment such as the 2s19 MSTAS-s self-propelled artillery platform, the 2s7 Psion and the TOS-1 Burantino artillery systems; the (infamous) 9k37 BUK Anti-Aircraft Missile System, the Tunguska Self-Propelled Anti-Aircraft Gun and Missile System; the T-90a, the T-80u, the up-armoured T-72bv and the T-62e tanks as well as the BTR-80, BRM-1k, BMP-3 and the Gaz Tigr Armoured Personnel Carriers. Along with modern anti-tank rounds, artillery rounds (such as Rocket Assisted projectiles) and a new threat for the battlefield: DRONES!

Using this book you can field any modern Russian Army force –not just for the current crisis in Ukraine but for many other what-if scenarios such as World War III, Invasion of Poland and other nightmare scenarios of your devising!

This book is fully compatible with other titles by Dean Wilson and is recommend for the COLD WAR3! Modern Combined Arms Rules System –but is perfectly compatible with Batlefront ™ Team Yankee and Flames of War systems. Ideally suited for 15mm but can use any scale from 6mm to 1:32!!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Royal Thai Army: History, Organisation and Insurrection 2000 to 2014
boardgame.description:
The Royal Thai Army: History, Organisation and Insurrection 2000 to 2014 covers the area of instability, protests and coup's as well as the ongoing (and continuing) Southern Insurgency (where the RTA and RTP are fighting the Islamic separatists and IS).

This book works for 6mm, 15mm and 20mm (1:72) scales and any combination thereof and is ideally for COLD WAR3! Set of rules but is compatible with any of the popular 15mm tabletop rules such as TY and FoW and any titles produced by Dean Wilson.

This book covers the organisation of the Royal Thai Army, including all of their equipment (from M48a3 tanks through to the modern T80u's from Ukraine), Humvee's and Honda Pick-Up trucks as well as artillery such as the 105mm Field Howitzer, M-109a1 Paladin and the ubiquitous 81mm mortar!

All major Thai units such as the Thahan Phranh (Rangers), the Cavalry and the Armoured units are included as well as weapons from the AK-47 right through to the newly acquired Tavor though the M16 and G3 rifles.

The Royal Thai Police, including the Naresuan-261 (HRT unit), the PARU (SWAT), Border Police and the RTP Special Branch -including their equipment such as UH-1D helicopters, Unimog trucks, pick-up trucks, Tactical vehicles, and all light weapons from the AK through to the M16 and M203 grenade launcher.

The Southern Insurgents are included with their diverse equipment such as 122mm rockets, 120mm mortars, road side bombs, person borne bombs, assault teams and so on. Two 'drug dealing' armies are included, the LAO Drug Barons and the Burmese Drug barons -so you can play interdiction missions along the Thai borders where Border Police, Army rangers and any units in-between interdict and fight it out with heavily armed drug lords and their private militias.

There is also a comprehensive army list for protesting factions (of either the red or yellowshirt variety and any hue in between such as white, lilac, pink or even rainbow coloured!) including taxies, LPG Gas Tankers, protesters, agitators, grenade units, medics, civilians and armed sections.

A comprehensive rules section covers drones, tyre fires, taxies (used to blockade routes) army riot squads and police riot squads, engineers, roadside bombs and all wepaons in-between! A campaign and scenario section is included as well as a detailed look at how to asemble and paint a RTP and RTA force.

A very detailed history section detailing the various protests, the ongoing insurgency in southern Thailand as well as the history and organisation of the Royal Thai Army and Police is also included.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Oh Poo!
boardgame.description:
Oh Poo is not just another card elimination game. Sure, you discard and pass cards, but you also get to flush and plunge them as well. All you need to do to win is avoid being the player last to hold the Poo Card!

Game Play Instructions: Don’t get stuck holding the Poo! Flush it, use the plunger, trick a fellow player into taking it off your hands... Keep it far away!

Getting Started: Shuffle the deck and deal out all cards. Some players may have an extra card compared to other players. That’s okay! Look at the cards you were dealt. If you have any two matching food card pairs discard them into a discard pile. ***If you have three of the same cards, you discard two (one pair). If you have four of the same cards you can discard all four (two pair).

Don’t let any players see your cards that are not able to be discarded! Keep them secret!

After all players have discarded matching pairs, the youngest player goes first by drawing a single random card from the player on their right. Any new matching food card pairs, if a matching card was drawn, gets discarded right away and then the player on the right does the same, going around the table allowing each player to draw one card and discard pairs if able.


Anytime two food cards match they should be discarded.




The Plunger Card: If you have a Plunger Card you can play it at the beginning of your turn or at the very end of your turn. When you play a Plunger Card it gets discarded immediately and is removed from the game. Playing the Plunger Card switches the direction players draw cards from. If the table had been drawing cards from the player on their right, they would now switch to drawing cards from the player on their left. Anytime a Plunger Card is played the direction changes. There are only four Plunger Cards in the deck.

The Toilet Card: The Toilet Card never gets discarded, but can switch from player to player if randomly drawn. Whenever you have the Toilet Card and the Poo Card in your hand you can flush the Poo Card by giving it to any player of your choice. When flushing the Poo you have to show everybody you have the toilet card. You keep the Toilet Card in your hand after flushing the poo, as it could be drawn by the player drawing cards from you on their next turn.

The Poo Card: If you are left with no food cards in your hand and don’t have the Toilet Card, but are holding the Poo Card, you lose the game. OH POO!

Anytime you discard all your food cards and have no other cards in your hand during your turn, you are ‘out’ and can sit back and watch the remaining players struggle to avoid being stuck with the Poo Card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cyberpunk Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Nobody looks up anymore. There isn’t any point. If you’re lucky you only have the glare of the neon lights and the constant bombardment of advertisements coming from every possible angle. If you’re unlucky it’s the smog and the crumbling buildings of whatever forgotten crack of the world you’ve had to eke out some meager existence in. The crowds are too thick, the world too cynical, and what little bounty is there to be had is in the hands of the corporations and elite. But people survive and trudge on-wards as they always have. A thousand stories walking past you every day on the street. Some grim, some hopeful, with as many endings and meanings as there are participants. But now, we’re here to see the story of one person in particular. There are people out there with tools and knowledge that could redefine our most basic assumptions about reality, the mind, what it means to be human. There are people out there who are fighting to grind others into the dirt for their own profit and power. There are people who are risking what precious little they have to try and stop them from succeeding.

boardgame.description:
Canuck! The 4th Canadian Mechanised Brigade 1968-1993 covers the Canadian deployment to West Germany in support of NATO between 1968 and the draw down in '93 (after the end of the Cold War).

Suitable for 6mm, 15mm and 20mm (1:72) tabletop wargaming miniatures and ideally for COLD WAR3!
this rulebook supplement is also compatible with other 15mm popular tabletop games such as TY and FoW.

Armed with this book you can field a 4th CMB force for early, middle and late Cold War. It covers all Canadian equipment such as Lynx Recon APC's (baby M113's!), Ferret's (British Armoured Cars), centurion through to Leopard 2a4 Main Battle Tanks, 6 wheeled Cougars, Huskies and Grizlies as well as 8 weeled LAV's and 4x4 VW Iltis and M151 Jeeps.

Air support is also included from the F104 Starfighter, the CF-86 Sabre and the CF-188 Hornet along with all various air launched nasties such as rocket pods, air to air and air to ground missiles, bombs and napalm to seriously ruin any Soviet commanders day.

Rules for Canadian engineering vehicles, Assault-M113's, minefields and entrenchments; battlefield recovery and repair, medic sections and air observers mounted in Kiowa helicopters or Cesna aircraft.

NATO air defences in the form of Chaparal or West German Roland or gepards are included to bolster the 4CMB's AA assets (alongside their own Blowpipe sections of the RCHA).

Princess Patricias Light Infantry, Lord Strathcon's Horse, the Royal Canadian Regiment, Royal Canadian Horse Artillery, Royal Canadian Dragoons and Fort Garries Horse are all included as well as a background and historical section and a comprehensive how to paint your Canuck force! Alongside a list of stockists who supply suitable 15mm Canadian models.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hex Command: Gunpowder â The Horse and Musket Era with Pike and Shot Addendum
boardgame.description:
Hex Command Gunpowder are rules for miniature gaming the horse and musket era.
Also includes rules for the Pike and Shotte era.

These rules for miniature war gaming combine board game mechanics with miniatures, where the basic concepts and intent of the rules is to be shared or made common with other rules in the Hex Command System: Ancients, Mechanized and more.
Where possible, as many common concepts and procedures were to be incorporated so that once a particular set was learned, the other rules would find the same intentions.

Hex Command avoids complex issues of movement and measuring due to the use of a hex grid, and infantry regiments do not consist of multiple stands and are not concerned with formations. When a is "Fatigued" it means it has reached the limit of encountering obstacles and efforts such as melee.

To win this game, players must observe the tactical reserve, maneuvering the enemy, and supported combat. Use of Game Cards keep players from being all-knowing and all-seeing above the game table... the fog of war element.

—description from the introduction of the book from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aye Aye Island: A Pirate Odyssey
boardgame.description:
You‘re a pirate! ... A gentleman or lady of “the sweet trade“!
Actually... A good-for-nothing of the worst kind!
So naturally you are keen on fat prey... Aye?
How about a legendary emerald, as clear and pure as a mountain stream and as big and heavy as the thick skull of an old drunkard?

The enchanted gem stone „ALLWATYAWANT“.
Legend has it that this gem is supposed to fulfil every wish.
Tempting - isn´t it? Of course it is!
The aim of the game is to rip this treasure under your dirty nails before someone else does. There‘s only the one or the other catch. On the one hand you still are on the wrong island and unfortunately you have to find a treasure map here first, on the other hand you have to collect 5 different building materials for a proper raft in order to travel to the treasure island. However, the island won´t reveal neither the treasure map nor resources voluntarily. You will have to explore the island and find what you need or “acquire“ it otherwise. You will, good or bad, find much more than you like. The island holds innumerable dangers and adventures for you, which have to be conquered in order to leave the island. It goes without saying that also the deeps of the sea are pretty demanding too. Basically you could bathe in adventures.
Apart from that... You are not the only scoundrel who is after the treasure and you will have to deal with your opponents in many different ways. You better leave moral considerations to the landlubbers.... Aye!!!????

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Godling Legacy Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Claim the Power of the Gods!

The power of the gods is beyond mortal comprehension. When some gods are elder beings that even other divinities call ancient, and some are elevated mortals, and even androids and machines can become gods, who can say that the dividing line between mortal and gods is clear and bright?

Within that gray zone exist the godlings—be they scions who walk their own path while harnessing a fraction of their divine parent’s powers, mortals who have been exposed to relics from lost cultures millions of years old, or just drunkards who somehow came across a test for godhood in the stars and neither passed nor failed. They are not yet gods, but have set their first foot upon that path.

This product includes four godling subclasses—adept, clever, eldritch, and mighty. Whether they are drawing on powers from the void, mastering multiple schools of magic, tricking foes with immortal cunning, or shattering targets with the pure power of divinely-enhanced forms, each godling can call on a range of powers from elemental and alignment-themed divine gifts, to the power to fight starships one-on one.

boardgame.name: Under the Scale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lament of the Apocalypse Dragons and the Fight for the Ember’d Crown

The once vibrant and expansive cultures of Taragainya ended with the coming of the Great Dragons. For decades now, the small folk concentrated on little more than survival. Communities fragmented into ever-smaller groups to hide from the agents of the Dragons. Many Elves, Humans and Dwarves retreated into magical fortresses in the hopes the Dragons and their minions would not follow.

The shadows of the Great Dragons grew long and ancient. The world suffocated and withered.

But! There are now signs this horror is coming to an end. All but one of the Great Dragons slumber. As the holdfasts open, the Free Folk begin to explore their changed world and reclaim ancient legacies.

Now is the time to craft new stories of hope.

Now is the time for heroes.

In this campaign setting book for the fifth edition of the world's oldest fantasy roleplaying game, you will find:

All new character creation options — including new sub-classes. backgrounds, mechanics, and feats.
More races! Reimagined Elves, Humans, Dwarves, Halflings, Dragon-men, and Orks as well as all new races like the hybrid Stou, and the stalwart half-giants known as the Gargants.
A setting built to feel like a living and breathing world. Extensive lore and adventure seeds to jumpstart your stories.


What makes Under the Scale a different kind of fantasy setting:

An unapologetic focus on making the races and character classes powerful and distinct from one another - even at lower levels. A 1st level elf feels and plays different from a 1st level human.
The setting is built to provide players with missions, goals, and a sense of purpose right from the outset.
A focus on classes and mechanics that tell their own part of the Under the Scale story. As well as design decisons to make rolls a bit more dynamic.

boardgame.name: Dystopia 23 the Razors Edge Primer - Condensed Rules and Mission
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dystopia 23 the Razors Edge is an action packed role-playing game set in a harsh dystopian near future. Imagine a world that has fallen into chaos following an economic crisis of unprecedented proportions. It’s not too difficult! The way of life on planet Earth has changed dramatically, poverty is rampant, crime and violence have reached unparalleled levels and the chasm between rich and poor has become immense. In the midst of this trouble gigantic megacorporations rose from the ashes to claim dominance over world affairs. Their influence is terrifying, having wrapped their tentacles around economic, civil, political and even military realms.

This book is an introductory primer to the world of Dystopia 23. It has been written to allow you to learn the fundamentals of the gaming system and to play through a short sample scenario before buying the game proper. It is not a complete set of game rules. The rules in this book have been stripped down to the bare minimum to enable you to play through the scenario mission. The actual Dystopia 23 core rulebook has almost 400 pages of rules detailing every aspect of the game from creating characters through to combat and hacking in the Nexus.

boardgame.name: To Arms!: Core Rules for Historical Battles
boardgame.description:
To Arms! is an easy and fast ruleset for historical games.

This core rulebook focus on the ancient part but the rules can be used for 3000BC~1865AD.

The book is written in simple English.
It's very easy to read and understand.

Diagrams in each key step guide you how to play the game.

The featured Order of Activation makes the game feel like a RTS game. Not I-Go-U-Go, no PIPs. All the troops have chance to move in every turn.

The game length is about 1 Hour. You only need A Tape Measure and Some D6 Dice. Almost no counters or markers are needed. No chart looking, most of the combat is judged by Roll-Off. Figures are individually based and formed in ranks and files. If you want to play with DBx bases, that's also fine. You just need some markers to track the casualty.

Overall, it's a easy and fast ruleset. It's good for beginners. Experienced players can also have funs. To Arms! is not a highly realistic battle simulation but a game of leisure and fun.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Depicted
boardgame.description:
Depicted is a conceptual, abstract boardgame where players match images with attributes to gain territory.

Matching justification can vary by age group and is designed to encourage dialogue and conceptual thinking.

Tiles are flipped to claim spaces by arrow direction.
Players score a point every time they control four contiguous spaces.

The board constantly changes as board spaces are reclaimed with new images, making for a very dynamic game.
The first player to accumulate 20 points wins.

Themes:
* Symbols - uses coloured shapes
* Classic - use generic images
* Nature - Mother Nature
* Muskoka - Ontario Canada cottage country.

Game Components:

The 12x12 inch x 1/4 inch laser-cut wooden game board consists of:
* room for 100 or 121 territorial tile spaces
* four built-in scoring tracks.

The game includes:
* at least 100 two-sided image tiles (depending on theme)
* 20-40+ attribute cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Big Job
boardgame.description:
I’ve got a new job for you and your crew. There’s this new bank called the Mega Bank. The bank itself consists of 4 giant vaults. There must be millions stored in each. Your job is to find those vaults, stuff as much money down your pockets, and get out before you get busted. The police are stationed all around the bank. So you have to be careful. For the entire year, we can make this bank our primary target. So what do you say, are you in?

Welcome to The Big Job. The card game that tests your luck and greed to become rich. Are you lucky enough to hit the jackpot and avoid detection? Drawing the million dollar card and leaving with what you've got sounds like a lucky way to get rich. Or do you hunger the greed and adrenaline rush of taking hostages and pulling off some big time cash while dodging the police? Clearing out all the vaults and ransoming up a hostage for millions of dollars sounds right up your alley. Just try not to get busted in the process. It's going to cost ya! Grab your crew and lets head out for the big job!

If you're looking for a snatch and grab game to play with family and friends that requires no strategy, just sheer luck and greed, The Big Job is the perfect game for you. The Big Job is very easy to learn and play with others. Setup 4 decks and then just take turns pulling cards. Sounds very simple right? If only pulling money from a deck of cards was real. While the chances of getting caught are slim your greed will be your demise.

As The Big Job may seem like a very simple game with no strategy what so ever, it will keep you immersed with greed and other players’ demises. Trust us the only player that can hurt you is you. So make sure you choose wisely, whether it’s to keep drawing money or to just call it quits.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Continent Race
boardgame.description:
Continent Race by Byron’s Games is a world geography board game that features the national flags of countries throughout the world. The game is for 2+ players, ages 7 and up. It’s a race, and the first player to collect the required number of country cards from each continent wins the game. Supporting materials include Maps, Mystery Continent cards, Antarctica wild cards with special privileges, and there is an option to do a one-on-one challenge between 2 players to enhance the learning. The game is color-coded for easier access for children and allows for younger players to take part too. Continent Race is a collaborative way to learn world geography and promotes problem solving skills, goal achievement, and focused play. Continent Race is the recipient of 4 game awards.

For the basic level of play, the game is complete once a player collects the necessary number of country cards for three continents. Two cards must be collected from Australia/Oceania and four cards each from Africa, Asia, the Americas, and Europe. For the advanced level of the game is complete once a player collects the required number of cards for five continents. At this level, Orange Mystery cards can be shuï¬ed into the deck to increase the level of diï¬culty. Players must first determine which continent a Mystery card belongs to (using maps and other players as resources), then use the card as you would any other country card to complete a continent group. Also at the advanced level, Challenge play is an option, where one player invites another player to face oï¬ with cards that feature the Challenge symbol. Each challenger gets to review the Continent List or Map and then, from memory, each player must name as many countries as s/he can recall from that continent by taking turns saying the names of countries aloud, until one player gets stumped. The winner of the challenge gets to draw additional cards.

Gameplay starts with the dealer dealing 7 cards, face down, to each player. On each turn, a player draws one card and discards one card face up. Each time a player discards, s/he must announce the country name and continent of the discarded card. On each turn, a player selects one card from the draw pile and decides if they want to keep it or discard it. If a player picks a country card that matches one of his/her continents and the country card completes one of the continent groups, then the player has successfully completed a continent group and must place the continent group on the table, face up, and announce the names of the countries in the continent group. (You can review phonetic pronunciations on our site.) Next, the player must replace, from the draw pile, the number of cards s/he laid down in order to bring the player’s hand back to 7 cards. Then, it’s the next player’s turn.

The ï¬rst person to collect the required number of country cards for each continent group is mere steps from winning the game! To fully complete the game, the winner MUST call out and locate on the maps the countries they’ve drawn throughout the game. Others may continue playing for 2nd, 3rd, 4th place… for an enhanced learning experience.

Continent Race was created by young Byron, just 6 years old at the time, during a month-long stay at a children’s hospital. Not only was Byron receiving treatment for an unexpected illness, he was receiving something else entirely: The inspiration to help kids like him learn and have fun through their hospital stay and beyond. Byron’s dream came to life in December 2018—with the help of a Kickstarter campaign, we sent Continent Race to over 130 children’s hospitals nationwide. NBC covered the story on Byron and his game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rivet
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Rivet is a role-playing system that emphasizes fast conflict resolution and larger-than-life actions. It uses dice, with a standard deck of playing cards used as a "good luck" mechanism that may give the player some control over the situation or additional dice to add to their check.

Characters have six attributes: Brains, Brawn, Aim, Flair, Moxie and Luck. These are all rated from d6 to d20. Every task check is simply two attribute dice rolled together. For example, a character with d8 Brains and d20 luck rolls 1d8+1d20 to make a Flying check. Special qualities may give bonuses to these or have other special effects.

The default setting is an alternate-reality United States during a prolonged World War II, but the system was designed with the spirit of any pulp WW2-era or dieselpunk setting in mind.
